summary: The Pecos Watershed Protection Act aims to protect the Pecos Watershed area in New Mexico. It withdraws specified Federal land from mineral entry and designates the Thompson Peak Wilderness Area, managed by the Forest Service. The bill outlines the withdrawal's scope, administration of the wilderness area (including grazing, fish and wildlife management, and control of fire, insects, and diseases), and the treatment of acquired land. It also includes the withdrawal of the wilderness area from mineral-related activities and public land laws.
